Security tool processes or services bein.Data: Windows Event ID 4688, Windows Event ID 7036
Security tool processes or services bein.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 4688 and 7036. Identify security service names and common process names of security tools. Look for unexpected stop events (7036) or commands (4688) targeting these processes/services. Use correlation analysis to link process termination events with suspicious parent processes.

Registry keys, configuration files, or l.Data: Windows Event ID 4657, Windows Event ID 1102, Windows Event ID 104, Windows Event ID 1104
Registry keys, configuration files, or l.Action: Monitor Windows Event IDs 4657 for modifications to known security tool registry keys (e.g., service configurations, startup entries). Monitor Event IDs 1102, 104, 1104 for security/system log clearing events. Identify baseline frequency of these events. Flag unexpected spikes in registry modifications or log clearing events (e.g., using time series analysis on event counts).
